articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Jana Novotna: Former Wimbledon champion dies at age of 49
articles.description: Former tennis player Jana Novotna, who won Wimbledon in 1998, dies at the age of 49.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Tony Pulis: West Brom sack manager after Chelsea defeat
articles.description: Tony Pulis is sacked by West Brom with the club a point above the relegation zone and without a win in 10 Premier League games.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Ashes: Australia plan to 'open a few England scars' in first Test in Brisbane
articles.description: England will be reminded of their failings from the 2013-14 Ashes whitewash when this series gets under way, says Australia paceman Josh Hazlewood.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Scotland call for fit-again Sean Maitland and Fraser Brown
articles.description: Fit-again Saracens wing Sean Maitland and Glasgow Warriors hooker Fraser Brown join the Scotland squad ahead of Australia's visit.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Garth Crooks' team of the week: Ozil, Sanchez, Salah, Wilson
articles.description: Garth Crooks gets whimsical over one player's magnificence and includes three from one North London club in his team of the week.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Autumn internationals: Jeremy Guscott on Scotland, England, Wales and Ireland
articles.description: Scotland's agonising loss to New Zealand, England's demolition of Australia and Wales and Ireland's narrow wins are assessed by Jeremy Guscott.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Mohamed Salah: Egypt striker carries hopes of a nation at World Cup
articles.description: Mohamed Salah, who has never even seen Egypt play in a World Cup, will carry the expectations of a nation when they compete at Russia 2018.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Jason Gillespie: Sussex appoint former Australia bowler as head coach
articles.description: Sussex appoint ex-Australia bowler Jason Gillespie, who coached Yorkshire to two Championship titles, as their new head coach.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Sarah Hunter to win 100th cap for England
articles.description: England women's captain Sarah Hunter will win her 100th cap when she leads her country against Canada on Tuesday.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Rugby League World Cup shuffle: A psychic croc an early start and emotional Fijians.
articles.description: Watch the best bits from the quarter-finals of the Rugby League World Cup including Burt the psychic crocodile, an early wake-up call and emotional Fijians.
